title: Job Openings at Xpedient Services
content:
Xpedient Services is a human resource management, training and consulting company. We offer innovative, seamless HR services which include recruitment, training, organizational restructuring, HR payroll and other services that meet both individuals, small, medium and large organizational needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Content Creator / Photographer

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Content Creator/Photographer is responsible for producing high-quality visual and written content that showcases PayChex International’s projects, business activities, teams, and milestones.
	This role requires frequent travel to various company locations to capture real-time images, videos, interviews, and stories that can be used across digital platforms, marketing materials, corporate reports, and internal communications.


Job Descriptions


	Capture professional photos and videos of company projects, operations, events, and personnel across all locations.
	Produce creative digital content (short clips, reels, photo stories, interviews, behind the-scenes features, etc.).
	Conduct on-site coverage of milestones, project progress, inaugurations, and client engagements. • Edit and enhance photos and videos for publication using industry-standard tools.
	Create engaging captions, write-ups, and summaries to accompany visual content.
	Develop human-interest stories, staff profiles, and project features for corporate communication channels.
	Collaborate with Communications/Marketing team to ensure alignment with brand identity and messaging.
	Provide content for the company’s website, social media pages, newsletters, and promotional materials.
	Assist in content planning and scheduling for campaigns and updates.
	Plan and execute content coverage trips in collaboration with project managers and site leads.
	Maintain a calendar of coverage activities and ensure timely content delivery.
	Organize and maintain a digital archive of photos, videos, and content assets.
	Ensure all content is backed up, tagged, and classified for easy retrieval.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in any field
	2 – 5 years of proven experience in photography, videography, and digital content creation.
	Strong portfolio showcasing photo/video and storytelling skills.
	Experience covering corporate activities, construction sites, field projects, or events is an added advantage.


Additional Requirements:


	Willingness to travel across states or regions as required.
	Ability to work in dynamic environments (construction sites, field operations, offices, events).
	Availability for weekend or extended-hour assignments when necessary.


Skills & Competencies:


	Proficiency in photography and video equipment.
	Strong editing skills using tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Premiere Pro, Lightroom, Final Cut Pro, or similar.
	Creative storytelling and copywriting ability.
	Social media and digital content strategy awareness.
	Ability to work independently and travel frequently.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Time management, flexibility, and attention to detail.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: samuelkise@xpedient.services using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For more enquires send a WhatsApp message to: 08184305914.

 

 

2.) Professional Nanny

Job Location: Maitama, Abuja (FCT)
Reports To: Creche Supervisor / Creche Manager
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Monday - Friday.

Role Summary


	The Nanny is responsible for providing attentive and professional care to children within the creche.
	This includes supporting their daily routines, ensuring their safety and well-being, and under the guidance of the Crèche Supervisor and Manager.


Description


	Provide direct care for children, including feeding, changing, and supervising playtime.
	Ensure a safe, clean, and nurturing environment at all times.
	Observe and report any health, behavioural, or developmental concerns to the Crèchesupervisor.
	Follow daily routines such as eating, resting, and playtime.
	Care for children’s safety, comfort, and well-being at all times.
	Follow set times for meals, naps, and bedtime.
	Engage children in simple learning and creative play.
	Build warm and caring relationships with children.
	Clean toys, play areas, and equipment regularly.
	Assist parents during drop-off and pick-up times.
	Observe children’s behaviour and development.
	Encourage parents to talk to the supervisor about children’s daily activities and needs.
	Ensure a safe and tidy environment, including cleaning and organizing children’s spaces.
	Report health concerns quickly.
	Encourage good manners and positive behaviour.
	Keep children’s areas clean and organized.
	Respect family privacy and maintain confidentiality at all times.
	Be flexible and adaptable to the parents' schedule and needs..
	Undertake any additional duties as may be assigned by management.


Qualifications and Skills


	Qualifications: Secondary School Certificate.
	Experience: No prior experience required; training provided.
	Skills: Willingness to learn, basic child development understanding


Salary
N100,00 - N150,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 2nd November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chizimushie@xpedient.services using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Creche Manager

Job Location: Maitama, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Monday - Friday
Reports To: Management

Role Summary


	The Crèche Manager is responsible for the overall leadership, management, and smooth running of the crèche facility.
	The role demands a balance of childcare expertise, operational management, and excellent interpersonal skills.


Responsibilities


	Ensure the health, safety, and welfare of all children at all times.
	Develop and implement age-appropriate learning and play activities.
	Monitor and record the developmental progress of children.
	Oversee daily crèche operations, ensuring a clean, safe, and welcoming environment.
	Manage resources, equipment, and supplies efficiently.
	Maintain accurate documentation, including attendance, incident, and health records.
	Train, and supervise childcare staff
	Prepare duty rosters and delegate responsibilities effectively.
	Conduct staff performance reviews and promote professional development.
	Act as the primary point of contact for parents and guardians.
	Provide regular updates on children’s progress and well-being.
	Handle concerns and complaints professionally and promptly.
	Manage budgets, procurement, and financial planning for the crèche.
	Ensure compliance with all childcare regulations and inspection requirements.
	Build and maintain relationships with external agencies, healthcare providers, and regulators.
	Prepare and submit timely reports to management.
	Foster an inclusive environment that supports diversity and respect for all children.
	Collaborate with parents to create individualized care or learning plans where necessary
	Establish and enforce policies on hygiene, nutrition, and behavior management
	Develop emergency preparedness plans and conduct regular safety drills.
	Ensure a positive, supportive work culture that encourages teamwork among staff.
	Undertake any additional duties as may be assigned by management.


Requirements


	Qualifications: Registered Nurse, Postgraduate Diploma in Public Health.
	Experience: 5 years in childcare or related field.
	Skills: Leadership, communication, and health and safety knowledge.


Salary
N300,00 - N400,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 3rd November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV with professional Cover letter to: chizimushie@xpedient.services using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified and suitable candidates will be contacted.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Hec Recruit
content:
Hec Recruit is a full-service HR consulting firm with a unique approach. Since 2020 we have been helping our clients find a job best suited for their skills and interests, and helping local companies locate the best employees.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Pharmacist

Job Locations: Victoria Island & Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Community Pharmacy
Workplace Type: On Site

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Community pharmacists are well-respected professionals within their local community who use their expert knowledge of medicines to help patients get the best possible care and outcomes from their medicines.
	As a community pharmacist, you'll be responsible for dispensing prescription and over-the-counter medicines that help people to maintain and improve their lives, in a cost-effective way.
	You will be responsible for constantly monitoring the quality, safety, and use of medicines, which requires a high level of interaction with patients, providing advice and information about the use of medicines and medical appliances.
	As a community pharmacist, you will work alongside pharmacy technicians and pharmacy support staff, such as pharmacy assistants to deliver the pharmacy service.
	Each person is a high valued member of the pharmacy team.
	Your location of work will typically be a high street pharmacy, part of a chain or an independent, or you might work in a doctor's practice or health centre.


Requirements


	B.Pharm
	Post NYSC experience.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hecrecruitment.hrconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Baker

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Baker to join our team in Surulere, Lagos.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing a variety of baked goods, such as bread, cakes, and pastries, to the highest standards of quality and presentation.
	If you have a passion for baking and a keen eye for detail, we would love to hear from you.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and bake a variety of bread, cakes, and pastries to the highest standards of quality and presentation
	Follow recipes and production schedules to ensure timely delivery of products
	Maintain a clean and safe working environment, adhering to all health and safety regulations
	Monitor ingredient levels and order supplies as needed
	Collaborate with other team members to achieve production targets and meet customer demands
	Develop and implement new recipes and products to stay ahead of trends and customer preferences


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an SSCE / GCE / NECO qualification
	2+ years of experience as a Baker in a commercial bakery or similar environment
	Proven experience with baking bread, cakes, and pastries
	Strong knowledge of baking techniques, ingredients, and recipes
	Excellent attention to detail and quality control skills
	Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hecrecruitment.hrconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Cook

Job Location: Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Cook to prepare delicious meals for our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing and cooking a variety of dishes, maintaining a clean and safe kitchen environment, and ensuring that all meals are prepared to a high standard.


Responsibilities


	Prepare and cook a variety of meals, including breakfast, lunch, and dinner
	Plan and organize menus, taking into account dietary restrictions and preferences
	Maintain a clean and safe kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety regulations
	Ensure all meals are prepared to a high standard and presented in an appealing way
	Manage kitchen supplies and ingredients, ensuring that all items are stored properly and used efficiently
	Collaborate with other team members to ensure seamless service


Requirements


	2+ years of experience as a Cook in a busy kitchen environment
	Proven experience in preparing delicious and nutritious meals
	Ability to work efficiently and effectively in a fast-paced environment
	Good communication and teamwork skills
	Ability to follow recipes and instructions accurately
	Physical ability to stand for long periods and lift heavy objects


Salary
N80,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hecrecruitment.hrconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Medical Doctor

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a qualified and compassionate Medical Doctor to join our healthcare team.
	The successful candidate will provide high-quality patient care, diagnose and treat various medical conditions, and work collaboratively with other healthcare professionals to ensure excellent patient outcomes.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough medical examinations and assessments.
	Diagnose and manage various medical conditions, including acute and chronic illnesses.
	Develop and implement treatment plans.
	Prescribe medications and therapies.
	Provide preventive care and health education.
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.
	Maintain accurate medical records.
	Stay updated with medical advancements.


Requirements


	Medical Degree (MBBS).
	2 years of post NYSC experience.


Salary
N400,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hecrecruitment.hrconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Eric Kayser Nigeria
content:
Eric Kayser Nigeria is part of the globally renowned Maison Kayser brand, founded by master baker Eric Kayser in Paris, France. Established in Nigeria to bring authentic French bakery excellence to the local market, Eric Kayser Nigeria is known for its commitment to artisanal craftsmanship, high-quality ingredients, and exceptional customer experience. With locations in key parts of Lagos—including Victoria Island, Ikoyi, and the Murtala Muhammed Airport—Eric Kayser Nigeria offers a wide range of freshly baked breads, viennoiseries, pastries, and gourmet meals, all made with the finest techniques and natural sourdough.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



At the heart of Eric Kayser Nigeria is a dedication to excellence, innovation, and hospitality, making it a preferred destination for both everyday indulgence and premium café experiences. We are proud to uphold the global Kayser tradition while infusing it with local relevance and exceptional service tailored to the Nigerian market.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Maintenance Technician (Coffee Machine Specialist)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Ikoyi, Leila, Airport, and Chevron - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Engineering / Maintenance
Reports To: Facility Manager

Job Summary


	The Maintenance Technician (Coffee Machine Specialist) is responsible for the preventive and corrective maintenance of all electrical, mechanical, and kitchen equipment across Eric Kayser outlets — with a strong focus on coffee machine servicing, calibration, and repair.
	The role ensures that all equipment functions optimally to support uninterrupted operations, product quality, and customer satisfaction. The ideal candidate should possess solid technical knowledge of espresso machines, grinders, and brewing systems, along with general expertise in kitchen and bakery equipment maintenance.


Key Responsibilities
Equipment Maintenance & Repair:


	Carry out routine preventive maintenance on all coffee machines, grinders, ovens, chillers, freezers, dishwashers, mixers, and other electrical appliances.
	Diagnose faults and perform prompt corrective repairs on coffee machines (e.g., La Marzocco, Nuova Simonelli, Rancilio, or equivalent brands).
	Replace worn-out components (seals, gaskets, solenoids, thermostats, heating elements, etc.) to restore full functionality.
	Ensure all equipment is calibrated according to manufacturer and company standards.
	Maintain proper water filtration systems for all coffee machines.


Technical Troubleshooting:


	Respond quickly to emergency repair calls from outlets and diagnose issues on-site.
	Document fault causes, repair actions, and parts replaced after every service.
	Coordinate with vendors or external engineers where specialized repairs are required.
	Ensure all safety standards and protocols are followed during maintenance and electrical work.


Preventive Maintenance:


	Develop and implement a monthly preventive maintenance schedule for all outlets.
	Conduct performance checks and service logs for each coffee machine and other key kitchen equipment.
	Advise management on potential risks, recurring faults, or obsolete equipment that require replacement or upgrade.


Coordination & Reporting:


	Work closely with the Facility Manager and Operations Team to plan maintenance visits with minimal disruption to operations.
	Keep accurate records of maintenance activities, spare parts used, and work completed.
	Prepare weekly maintenance reports and share updates with the Facility Manager and HR.
	Recommend sourcing options for high-quality spare parts and consumables for coffee machines.


•General Maintenance Support:


	Support electrical and plumbing repairs across outlets as needed.
	Perform installation, relocation, or calibration of new equipment.
	Maintain cleanliness and proper organization of the maintenance workshop and tools.


Qualifications & Experience


	OND / HND / B.Eng in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related technical discipline.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of proven experience as a Maintenance Technician in a hospitality, bakery, or café environment.
	Hands-on experience with commercial coffee machine brands (e.g., La Marzocco, Rancilio, Simonelli, Wega, or Expobar).
	Certification or formal training in coffee machine maintenance is an added advantage.
	Must be physically fit, reliable, and willing to travel between outlets when required.


Key Competencies & Skills:


	Strong expertise in coffee machine troubleshooting, descaling, programming, and calibration.
	Good knowledge of electrical systems, plumbing, and kitchen equipment.
	Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and respond swiftly to emergencies.
	Attention to detail and commitment to quality.
	Strong communication and teamwork abilities.


Working Conditions:


	Regular travel between outlets (V.I., Ikoyi, Leila, Airport, and Chevron).
	May be required to work weekends or after hours for urgent repairs.
	Must adhere strictly to safety, hygiene, and operational protocols.


Salary
N250,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Safely transport food items, supplies, and staff as required.
	Maintain cleanliness and good condition of the vehicle.
	Conduct routine checks on the vehicle to ensure it’s roadworthy.
	Follow all traffic laws and safety regulations.
	Perform other logistics or delivery duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE certification or equivalent qualification.
	3 - 5 years of relevant work experience.
	Valid driver’s license with a good driving record.
	Proven experience as a driver (experience in restaurant or logistics delivery is an advantage).
	Familiar with Lagos routes (or insert your city/area).
	Punctual, reliable, and well-organized.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Display Attendant

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a smart, attentive, and organized Display Attendant to join our team and help maintain an appealing and well-arranged food display area.


Responsibilities


	Arrange and restock food displays attractively and neatly.
	Ensure all displayed items are properly labeled and presented.
	Monitor food quality and appearance throughout the day.
	Maintain cleanliness and hygiene of the display area at all times.
	Assist customers courteously when needed.
	Work closely with the kitchen and service staff to ensure timely replenishment.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE or equivalent qualification.
	Previous experience in a restaurant or food service environment is an added advantage.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong attention to detail and cleanliness.
	Must be reliable, punctual, and presentable.


Salary
N80,000 per month. 

Method  of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@erickayserng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Head of IT Job at American Open University Nigeria




        
    

        
        American Open University Nigeria is not merely a new university; it is a transformative, industry-engaged, and competency-based institution designed to redefine higher education and prepare students for the future of work. Our mission is to empower students to learn locally and earn globally. Through our custom-built enterprise applications and strategic partnerships with tech giants like Google, Cisco, and Microsoft, we provide a learning experience on a par with the world's leading universities. 

Applications are invited from visionary builders and transformative leaders to join our senior management team in the capacity below:

Job Position: Head of IT

Job Location: Bodija, Ibadan - Oyo

Your Mission


	Architect and lead a world-class digital ecosystem that is the foundation of our university.
	You will drive our digital transformation, ensuring our custom enterprise applications, LMS, and IT infrastructure deliver a seamless, secure, and globally competitive user experience.

	Master's in IT or a related field, 10+ years of strategic IT leadership, and key industry certifications (e.g., CISSP, PMP, ITIL).
	You must be an expert in ODeL platforms and have a proven record of leading tech initiatives in a complex, global-facing organization.

	Tech-Savvy & Digitally Fluent: You must be proficient in leveraging technology to drive efficiency and innovation. Hands-on experience with enterprise applications (like ERPs, LMS) is essential.
	Global Mindset: You will contribute to an environment that opens global advantages to our students and staff, preparing them for international careers and collaboration.
	Commitment to Global Best Practices: You must have a deep understanding of the standards and experiences obtainable in leading global universities to support our diverse and international student body.
